cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.product

Class ProductAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.product.ProductAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProductAPI

    public class ProductAPI
extends java.lang.Object
implements IProductAPI
    A public API for interacting with the Mobile Application Store which allowed for the importation of new Content items as well as provides a search interface for that Content. Customers may use the API to search for Content items and supply detailed search criteria. Application Developers and Administrators may use the API to add new Content items, new Country items, and new Device by passing in filenames of CSV files with all data. Note that adding items to the product catalog is a "restricted interface"; only users that supply a valid access token (e.g., GUID) value to methods for importing/adding content will be allowed. Later an Authentication Service API will be built that will handle the actual authentication and authorization parts; the current version of the ProductAPI will only simulate the presence of a functional Authentication Service by accepting and requiring GUIDs be passed to restricted interface methods (e.g., content creation). The ProductAPI is a Singleton, so there is only ever one instance to use. Additionally, the ProductAPI uses the Flyweight pattern to ensure that there is only ever one instance of each Content, Device, and Country object so as to not needlessly duplicate things and waste memory and resources.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Killeffer <rayden7@gmail.com>
    See Also:
    ProductAPI, Content, ContentSearch

      • getInstance

        public static IProductAPI getInstance()
        Returns a reference to the single static instance of the ProductAPI.
        Returns:
        singleton instance of ProductAPI

      • validateAccessToken

        public boolean validateAccessToken(java.lang.String guid)
        Verifies that the guid access token passed is authenticated and authorized for carrying out restricted actions on the ProductAPI (such as adding new Content items, etc.). Note that for this version of the ProductAPI, this method is mocked and will return true for any string passed.
        Specified by:
        validateAccessToken in interface IProductAPI
        Parameters:
        guid - the string access token to check for authentication and authorization for carrying out restricted actions on the ProductAPI
        Returns:
        true if guid is authenticated and authorized to execute restricted actions on ProductAPI, false otherwise

      • importCountries

        public void importCountries(java.lang.String guid,
                   java.util.List<Country> countries)
        Public method for importing countries into the product catalog. Every Content item has a list of Country objects that the content item may be exported to. The ProductAPI maintains one unique instance of each Country object (follows the Flyweight pattern). Countries will be validated before being added to the product catalog; invalid countries will be skipped over and not added.
        Specified by:
        importCountries in interface IProductAPI
        Parameters:
        guid - a string token for a validated and authenticated user to allow restricted interface actions
        countries - list of Country objects to add to the product catalog

      • importDevices

        public void importDevices(java.lang.String guid,
                 java.util.List<Device> devices)
        Public method for importing devices into the product catalog. Every Content item has a list of supported Device objects that the content item may be downloaded onto. The ProductAPI maintains one unique instance of each Device object (follows the Flyweight pattern). Devices will be validated before being added to the product catalog; invalid devices will be skipped over and not added.
        Specified by:
        importDevices in interface IProductAPI
        Parameters:
        guid - a string token for a validated and authenticated user to allow restricted interface actions
        devices - list of Device objects to add to the product catalog

      • importContent

        public void importContent(java.lang.String guid,
                 java.util.List<Content> contentItems)
        Public method for importing Content items into the product catalog (content may be may be Application items, Ringtone items, or Wallpaper items). Each Content item in the product catalog is unique, so only one instance of each content item is allowed (follows the Flyweight pattern). Content items will be validated based on the ContentType of each item before being added to the product catalog; invalid content items will be skipped over and not added.
        Specified by:
        importContent in interface IProductAPI
        Parameters:
        guid - a string token for a validated and authenticated user to allow restricted interface actions
        contentItems - list of Content objects to add to the product catalog

      • searchContent

        public java.util.List<Content> searchContent(ContentSearch search)
        Search the Product catalog for all matching content items that correspond to the criteria in the supplied search object. If any content item in the product catalog has an attribute that matches any one of the supplied criteria in the search object, that content item will be included in the returned list of items. The search implicitly uses OR logic for determining if a Content item should match a given search criteria if that criteria is collection-based. For example, if the ContentSearch object passed has a non-null "devices" property and lists multiple devices, then all content items that match any of those devices will be returned.
        Specified by:
        searchContent in interface IProductAPI
        Parameters:
        search - a search object containing the criteria to use when searching the Product catalog
        Returns:
        list of all content items that match the supplied criteria in the search object, or an empty list if nothing found

      • getCountryByCode

        public Country getCountryByCode(java.lang.String code)
        Given a 2-character country code, search for any country that matches in the product catalog.
        Specified by:
        getCountryByCode in interface IProductAPI
        Parameters:
        code - a 2-character country code
        Returns:
        the found country with the matching code, or null if not found
